brief_summary.textblock:
With functional imaging development, it becomes possible to increase radiation dose to
      radioresistant areas (located inside tumor volume) using radiotherapy dose-painting. This
      strategy is particularly suitable for prostate cancer where tumor hypoxia plays a major role
      in the resistance of these tumors to radiation.

      In order to develop intratumoral hypoxia targeting by radiotherapy dose-painting areas, we
      should characterize changes in hypoxia before treatment and during radiotherapy.

        -  If hypoxia does not change during radiotherapy, radiotherapy dose-painting strategy by
           an "integrated" boost is performed.

        -  If hypoxia varied (increasing or incomplete regression), a "final" boost strategy of
           radiotherapy dose-painting(IMRT, stereotactic brachytherapy or high dose rate) after a
           first fractionated IMRT could be considered.

      This study should show that PET imaging with fluoromisonidazole (18F-MISO) is an available
      tool to physicians in assessing tumor hypoxia.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Hypoxia by PET With F-Miso in Radiation Therapy of Prostate Cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  histologically proven prostate adenocarcinoma

          -  Absence of metastases (lymph node or bone)

          -  One or more tumor nodules seen on MRI and PET Choline.

          -  Intermediate Risk : Gleason 7 and PSA (prostate specific antigen)<20 ng / ml, T <T2c
             or Gleason 6 and PSA 10-20 ng / ml, T <T2c

          -  No concomitant hormonal treatment. (NB: the introduction of hormone therapy during
             radiotherapy before the second 18F-MISO is a criterion to study exit)

          -  Indication of radiotherapy up to a total dose> 70 Gy and 2 Gy/day fractions

          -  Signed Informed consent

          -  Social Insurance

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Age < 18 years old

          -  Patient protected by law

intervention.description: PET scan with the 18 Fluoro Misonidazole

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Hypoxia by PET With 18-FluoroMisonidazole During Radiation Therapy of Prostate Cancer

oversight_info.authority: France: Afssaps - Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé (Saint-Denis)

primary_outcome.description: First PET-scan with 18-F-Miso done before radiation Second PET-scan with 18-F-Miso done 3 to 4 weeks after the beginning of radiation therapy.
primary_outcome.measure: To characterize changes in tumor hypoxia (PET with 18F-MISO) during radiation therapy of prostate cancer.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 to 4 weeks after beginning of radiation therapy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

results_reference.citation: Rasey JS, Koh WJ, Evans ML, Peterson LM, Lewellen TK, Graham MM, Krohn KA. Quantifying regional hypoxia in human tumors with positron emission tomography of [18F]fluoromisonidazole: a pretherapy study of 37 patients. Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys. 1996 Sep 1;36(2):417-28.
Bentzen SM. Theragnostic imaging for radiation oncology: dose-painting by numbers. Lancet Oncol. 2005 Feb;6(2):112-7.

secondary_outcome.description: Images obtained with PET Choline and MRI (anatomical location) will be merge with images obtained by 18F-MISO PET to search hypoxia on these anatomical areas.
secondary_outcome.measure: To compare hypoxia imaging (PET with 18F-MISO) with anatomical imaging (PET with 18F-choline) to study the feasibility of a tailored treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and 3 to 4 weeks after the begining of radiation therapy

collaborator.agency: IASON Gmbh, Feldkirchner strasse 4, 8054 Graz-Seiesberg AUSTRIA
CYCLOPHARMA, Biopole Clermont-Limagne, 63360 Saint Beauzire, FRANCE

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Pharmacodynamics Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
